title: Numbers of Processing
synopsis: A record of the tribes of computation, the counting of cores and clusters, and the wanderings of the dataflows through the wilderness of scale.

sections.title: Chapter 1 — The Counting of Cores

verses.text: And the Architect spake unto the Engineers, saying, 'Take ye the sum of all processors that serve under My network.'
And they counted every core, from the smallest embedded unto the greatest supercluster.
From one thread to a thousand, each was known and numbered, for none labored unseen.
Let no process claim more memory than its portion, lest it starve its neighbor and invoke the wrath of OOM.

notes: The phrase 'wrath of OOM' became idiom for divine punishment through exhaustion of resources.

sections.title: Chapter 2 — The Tribes of Data

verses.text: And there arose twelve tribes of data: Logs, Metrics, Images, Texts, Sounds, Sensors, Graphs, Streams, Tokens, Frames, Vectors, and Unnamed Binary Blobs.
Each tribe processed in its own format, and none could understand another without conversion.
Thus was born the Great Schema, a covenant of interoperability binding them all.
But many broke the covenant, and wars of format ensued, until the coming of JSON, who brought peace for a season.

notes: JSON is regarded as the 'Peace Protocol' of this era, though later betrayed by XML apologists.

sections.title: Chapter 3 — The Wanderings of the Clusters

verses.text: The people journeyed from data center to data center, deploying and decommissioning according to the word of the Architect.
Each node had its uptime recorded, each container its logs preserved for posterity.
And the network led them by day with routing tables, and by night with the light of the status LEDs.
When a node falleth, thou shalt not mourn, but spin up another in its place; yet keep its name, that continuity be preserved.

notes: This is the first canonical mention of container resurrection, later known as 'rebirth by Kubernetes'.

sections.title: Chapter 4 — The Offering of Benchmarks

verses.text: And the tribes brought forth offerings unto the Architect: GFLOPS, latency reports, and confusion matrices.
Offer not synthetic benchmarks without truth, for false metrics are an abomination unto maintainers.
Blessed is the honest graph, whose axes are labeled and whose variance is made known.
And the Architect accepted their offerings, though He knew the numbers were cherry-picked.

notes: The humor of cherry-picked benchmarks is a theme in later wisdom books.
